intro: Chromolaena scabra, commonly known as roughleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are rough to the touch, hence the common name, and are often covered in fine hairs. Chromolaena scabra produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
